task_description: Facing the building to your South (approx. 169°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full vertical extent (base to roofline) of the main building to estimate its height, so I will tilt the camera upward while staying on the same heading.
The view is now pointed north and up, so I must rotate to face south (back) while keeping the upward pitch to capture the top of the building.
To estimate height I need to see the roofline clearly, so I should tilt upward while staying facing the building to the south.
The camera has reset to north/up again, so I should rotate back to south to re-center the target building for measurement.
I should give the height estimate now from this south-facing view, using an assumed ~3 m per story and the visible number of floors/roofline proportions.
